oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1939-10-28 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from October 28, 1939. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Uncle Dave Macon and son Dorris Macon, the Crook Brothers, Zeke Clements, and Ford Rush. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Uncle Dave Macon; Dorris Macon; Crook Brothers; Zeke Clements; Ford Rush
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) David Stone announces the opening statement, the opening theme music plays, and David Stone introduces George D. Hay / (1:36) George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys / (1:46) Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys perform "Whoa Mule" / (3:03) David Stone announces a Prince Albert commercial / (3:47) George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon and Dorris Macon / (4:16) Uncle Dave Macon and Dorris Macon perform "Two-In-One Chewing Gum" / (6:05) George D. Hay introduces the Crook Brothers / (6:21) The Crook Brothers perform "Sally Gooden" / (7:43) George D. Hay introduces Zeke Clements / (8:02) Zeke Clements performs "Rocking And Rolling In The Saddle" / (9:55) George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush / (10:16) Ford Rush performs "There's A Goldmine In The Sky" / (12:30) David Stone announces a Prince Albert commercial / (13:04) George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff / (13:26) Roy Acuff performs "Answer To Sparkling Blue Eyes" [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Stone, David P., 1901-1995; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Macon, Uncle Dave, 1870-1952; Macon, Dorris; King, Pee Wee, 1914-2000; Golden West Cowboys (Musical group); Crook Brothers; Clements, Zeke
